The image is satirical because it contrasts how technology affects our perception and experience of reality. 

On the left, a large smartphone is depicted as displaying a vibrant, sunny landscape, while surrounded by small stick figures who seem captivated by it. This illustrates how people might be more engaged with digital representations of nature through devices, rather than experiencing it directly.

On the right, a computer monitor shows a version of the landscape that is dull and small, emphasizing how digital displays can sometimes poorly capture the beauty of real-life scenes.

The text "YES, BUT" suggests an ironic commentary on how technology promises an enhanced experience ("YES"), yet often delivers something less authentic ("BUT"). It's a humorous take on the way digital screens both connect and distance us from the natural world.
